body_content.explanation: of the highest quality, or being the most suitable, pleasing, or effective type of thing or person:
examples: This is the best meal I've ever had.
He's one of our best students.
Are you sure this is the best way of doing it?
What's the best (= shortest or quickest) way to get to their house?
Your parents only want what is best for you.
She was my best friend (= the friend I liked most).
It's best (= it is wise) to get to the supermarket early.

body_content.explanation: in the most suitable, pleasing, or satisfactory way, or to the greatest degree:
examples: Which evening would suit you best for the party?
The Grand Canyon is best seen at sunset.
He couldn't decide which one he liked best (= preferred).

body_content.explanation: to the greatest degree when used as the superlative of adjectives beginning with "good" or "well":
examples: They were the best-dressed couple at the party.
He was voted the best-looking (= most attractive) actor in Hollywood.

body_content.explanation: as well as you can:
examples: It is a difficult passage, but just translate it as best you can.

body_content.explanation: the most excellent in a group of things or people:
examples: My tastes are simple - I only like the best.
He wanted the best for his children - good schools, a nice house, and trips abroad.
I like all of Hitchcock's films, but I think "Notorious" is the best.
Chris and I are the best of friends (= we are very close friends).

body_content.explanation: used at the end of a friendly message or letter before writing your name:
examples: I'll call you early next week to set up a lunch date. Can't wait to meet you. Best, Beth Morris

body_content.explanation: used to say goodbye, or to end a letter to someone you know well, or to send good wishes to someone:
examples: All the best to your parents!

body_content.explanation: even when considered in the most positive way:
examples: The food was bland at best, and at worst completely inedible.

body_content.explanation: at the highest standard that can be achieved:
examples: The documentary was an example of investigative journalism at its best.

body_content.explanation: to be as active or intelligent as you can be:
examples: I'm not at my best in the morning.

body_content.explanation: this is the most pleasing thing:
examples: There was wonderful food, good company, and, best of all, a jazz band.

body_content.explanation: used to wish someone success before a test, etc. or a difficult activity:
examples: Best of luck on your finals!

body_content.explanation: In a sport such as tennis, if you play the best of a particular number of games, you play that number of games and the winner is the player who wins the greatest number of those games:
examples: Shall we play the best of five?

body_content.explanation: to make the greatest effort possible:
examples: It doesn't matter if you fail, just do your best.

body_content.explanation: If you have had the best of something, you have enjoyed the most pleasant part of it, and everything that is left is worse:
examples: I think we've already had the best of the hot weather this summer.

body_content.explanation: as well as you can:
examples: Just do the job to the best of your ability.

body_content.explanation: from what I know and understand from the information that I have:
examples: To the best of my knowledge, the chemicals which were found are not dangerous.

body_content.explanation: If an action is for the best, it is done to improve a situation or produce a good result, although it might seem unpleasant at the time:
examples: Ending a relationship is always hard but in this case it's for the best.

body_content.explanation: to make an unsatisfactory situation as pleasant as possible:
examples: We'll have to spend the night here, so we might as well make the best of it.

body_content.explanation: to defeat someone in a fight or competition:
examples: He bested his opponent in just two rounds.
